actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3667.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (NE) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3667 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for the reissuance of social security account numbers to young children in cases where confidentiality has been compromised."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Smith (NE) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1568.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Smith (NE) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1568 — "To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to protect personally identifiable information, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 16.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Ms. Balint to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 16.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Adrian Smith to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
